reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff super friendly and helpful and the hotel is beautiful. The free drinks and snacks between 5-7 were brilliant and we loved the roof terrace. We took advantage of drinks on the terrace a few times :) Fantastic location, we were able to walk everywhere, but if you don't fancy this there's a metro station very near. Only a couple of things we weren't happy with...Firstly, the hotel were aware that it was our honeymoon (I e-mailed them to try to pay extra for a room upgrade) - I was told the rooms were all of the same high standard, our room however was very, very small. Also, we weren't expecting any big "song and dance" but were suprised that we weren't told 'congratulations' when we arrived. Also, we were on the 6th floor....and the terrace is on the 7th floor...the noise wasn't too bad because we went to bed at about 1am anyway when the terrace closed, but on one particular night (the Friday) the noise was awful. Creaking and moving furniture all night and we didnt get to sleep until hours later.The next night had some noise again so it is probably just the weekends, as the whole week had been fine. Would definitely return to the hotel again, but maybe next time for just a few days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed for several nights over our 20th Wedding anniversary so we wanted more of a grown ups' hotel rather than one for young families. We got exactly that. The Hotel is comparitively small, i guess bijou was a word once used and is very clean and tidy furnished to a more modern design. We were on the 6th floor, the rooms were cleaned every day and done well , sound proofing seemed excellent as was the Air Con which worked well. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and as with most places you get out what you put in. The food from the restaurant was probably the best we had in Barcelona, and provided at exceptional value. So in terms of the hotel i really can't fault it.

That has its advantages as its fairly well located to some of the interesting places away from the Town Center such as Monjuic , However its going to take 15 - 20 Mins, to get to the Metro and then on to areas such as the Ramblas , Gothic Quarter or the Port areas. Personally we like walking and exploring so it was actually better to be slightly out of the mainstream areas and was a bit quieter as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with a relative for a long weekend in July. We were in Barcelona to see the sights and have some fun. I found the hotel through Tripadvisor. As the recommendations were very good I didn't hesitate to book. I liked the location of the hotel as it was outside of the chaos of the city centre and very near a metro station (Rocafort). The hotel interior can be called chic, but I found it cool and calming. Check in (in english) was fast, easy and helpful. The rooms were very well appointed, if a little small (but to be fair, it is a city centre after all). We were greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine, very nice touch. The bathrooms have an "open" shower, if you don't take care you can create your own wading pool. The shower temperature can be a touch binary at times, but not too bad. The aircon in the rooms was quiet and kept the room at a comforatble temperature. In general, the hotel is very quiet and I slept extremely well both nights, which is a feat in itself. Breakfast was excellent with a large (continental) selection to suit most diets. An evening drink on the terrace is a must. I enjoyed everything about the hotel pretty much.
reviews.title: Can't Wait to Visit Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect hotel 2 minutes walk from Rocafort Metro station. Spotlessly clean, excellent staff. A few people mentioned problems with air conditioning before, but ours worked perfectly. Lovely clean bathroom with great shower. Very quiet at night. Comfy bed. Mini bar in room. A few nice touches we liked were free internet on second floor, free tea/coffee and crossaints from 5pm - 8pm. Grand piano in the main bar with a pianst playing each night. Lovely roof top terrace bar over looking the city. There was nothing we could fault. We would definately stay here again & would 100 percent recommend to our friends. In fact, my sister is going there this September!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked Villa Emilia after reading the reviews on the Tripadvisor website and was definitely not disappointed. My husband was at a conference in Barcelona and I joined him for the weekend. I loved the interior design of the hotel. it was extremely clean and we had a lovely corner room with three full height windows which made the room lovely and bright. We had a tub with a shower over it and the strength of the shower certainly wakened us up in the morning. The mattress was firmer than most hotels but I liked that and I loved the big square pillows on the bed. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is just around the corner from the metro and has got lots of lovely looking restaurants nearby. We did not try any out though as we ate in the centre on both nights. On our return to the hotel on our first evening there was a pianist playing and we sat and enjoyed the ambience whilst having a glass of bubby. There is a really nice roof terrace where you can chill out and have coffee or a drink and something to eat. The breakfast is very good too - continental style with lots of pastries, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, bread, cereals. We ate in the hotel for lunch and had a really tasty mozzarella, tomato and avocado salad with our sandwiches. I found the hotel food and drink to be very reasonably priced, I actually found most of Barcelona to be that way too. On our second evening we ate at Taller de Tapas in the Born District next to the Santa Maria del Mar Church. We had to wait 30 minutes or so for a table but it was worth it. The atmosphere is buzzing and the food was delicious. We had 8 good sized tapas dishes with a side of tomato bread followed by Crema Calatana (which we shared!) and two soft drinks was around 50 euros.
reviews.title: Lovely, contemporary hotel in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of August (Bank Hols weekend) for my husbands 40th Birthday and we paid a good price through Last Min.com. We got 4 nights for the price of three (room only). First time to Barcelona and we found the staff in the hotel very helpful and friendly. The room was modern and the hotel was really clean and smelt fresh and clean at all times. The H2O spa products they provide for you are fab. Even though we took our own we used these products to try, the salt/sea body wash was to die for. We didnt eat at the hotel but the roof top bar is fantastic to chill out after a day sightseeing or in the evening. In the 3 days we were there we only saw a couple of people in the afternoon it was bliss. The hotel is a two minute walk to the metro but if you don’t want to take the metro at night and want to eat down at the port/beach you are looking at about £20 for a round trip in a taxi. We loved this hotel and felt safe in this area. The metro we found very good in the day for sightseeing we purchased a T10 ticket and this was value for money, it cost about 7 euros each and it lasted us 3 days. We have been to a lot of hotels all over the world and this hotel for a short break in Barcelona was really nice and we would recommend it. It doesn’t have a pool but for a short break you don’t need it and the weather in August was just right to walk about without being too hot. The surrounding area outside the hotel was ok if you fancy a take away pizza, if like us you are arriving after 11pm at night when the hotel restuarant is closed. There is a nice ice cream shop round the corner and a supermarket which is handy if you want drinks to put in the fridge in your room but the nice tapas restaurants and bars etc with some atmosphere are a metro or taxi ride away.

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Villa Emilia for 7 nights after booking through booking.com. We got a cheaper rate because we paid upfront when we booked (no cancellations/no exchanges). I had requested a quiet room and was not disappointed when I checked in. Room #61 is positioned on the top floor facing the interior, and they were serious when they said it was the most quiet room. The room is not huge, but it's a fair size... really it was everything we could have asked for given the price we paid and the request for a quiet room we made. (that being said, rooms on the 1st floor I would imagine to be incredibly noisy as their doors are facing the "business centre" where people are often sitting and there is music from the lobby that could be heard (e.g. a live piano at times).

The reason is that many of the Barcelona tourist sites are all over the place, so you will have to travel out at one point. Also I didn't want to be in a tourist hot zone because then I'd just be close to tourist traps... I wanted good local food... and although the immediate surroundings of Villa Emilia don't provide that, if you walk North to Hospital Clinic there are many restaurants that are delicious and at a reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel, modern, clean. Bathroom was excellent with walk-in shower and modern design. The roof terrace was good, Jazz trio playing in the background. Take my advice, get a day ticket for the nearby Metro at Rockfort, just a couple of minutes away for around 6 Euros for unlimited travel, its vital to get around as you are slightly out of the centre of the city in more of a residential area. The downside was a series of gaffes by the staff who seemed overstretched. This was disappointing as they were clearly nice people and willing to help. We ate in the hotel, the portions were extremely small, overpriced and my wifes Cod was raw in the middle. On the roof terrace they could not make our chosen cocktail because a machine had broken, then they ran out of glasses to serve us a beer. All small things of course, these things happen, but it let down what was otherwise a great experience. Despite this I would recommend this Hotel and would certainly consider going back.

reviews.text: The location is superb and metro travel is very cheap. We also walked around the local area and had some very reasonable and tasty meals in the surrounding area. The deli next door is super. We really recommend the Turistica bus as well - buy for 2 days - almost the same cost as one - and we spent half the day riding around looking where we wanted to go back to for the rest of the trip. it is worthwhile waiting to get on the roof top - in the end it was very quick even though the queues seemed very long, but if sunny make sure you have a hat! We loved all about Gaudi and even the queues went down very quickly so don't be put off by them. Park Gaudi great, we also did one organised trip through the tourist bureau and went to a vineyard, the monastery (wonderful views) and then short trip to Sitges. We were exhaused at the end of the 5 days, and still had loads to see.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is free internet access - but only one computer - so the downside of this was that there was a family with 2 teenage children staying who were constantly on 'myface'/'youtube' or similar - and they did not follow the concept that if people are waiting you limit your access to 30 minutes......Our only disappointment was the breakfast. After reading other reviews I used the Spainbookers web-site to book 3 nights for the price of 2, although we stayed 4 nights in total.When booking through spainbookers I booked and paid for the breakfast to be included, but when we got to the hotel they said this was not an option unless you book through the hotel's own web-site. Unfortunately, when booking through spainboookers your receipt only confirms the booking and not what was included and so although we had paid for the breakfast - which was very nice - we had to pay again. We did ask to speak to the manager - who we met with the next day - but he again said they did not include breakfast through e-bookers but did give us a free drink at the bar. So - if booking through spainbookers - which had a great rate- make sure you print off each page as you go through the booking so that you have proof.

reviews.text: We found a few issues, that might not necessarily bother some people. For example, the hotel advertises air conditioning in the rooms, however this is not on in the winter ( It was quite hot on the 6th floor) You couldnt sleep with the window open, as it was noisy. We also found the breakfast disappointing. Little choice, horrible tasting orange juice. The bar staff were very friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Villa Emilia in Barcelona. The hotel was lovely very modern and very well maintained. We arrived around 11am on a Sunday morning and where able to check in straight away to our double room. The rooms where a good size for a city hotel and the bathroom was very nice. The bed was comfortable and the sheets where of a good quality. The front desk were helpful with directions and gave us a map and a guide book.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Set in the centre of the City, the welcome that greets you as you walk inside is 1st class. We were immediately given a City map, Metro map, guidebook to Barcelona and a voucher for a free drink in the hotel. The room was very impressive, spotlessly clean, flat screen tv with very tasteful decor and full air con. There was free tea, coffee and snacks between 1700-1900 hours each day on the 1st floor where there was also free and fast broadband internet for use. The open top 7th floor terrace was spectacular with plush comfy chairs, cushions, large burning candles and very obliging staff. The views were for miles. The planes queueing to land at Barca airport could be seen in the distance over the Med. The staff at the hotel were fantastic, happily booking shows and taxis for us as well as giving guidance whenever asked. A thoroughly unforgettable holiday where the staff couldn´t do enough for you. The metro stop is only 100 yards away and is as easy to use as Londonś underground.

description: The Hotel Villa Emilia is a modern property situated in a prime location in the heart of Barcelona, perfect for business travelers and holidays trips. Its 53 double guestrooms are fully equipped and decorated with exquisite taste. Guests can enjoy Mediterranean food in the Zinc-Bar, lounge on our famous Terrace, enjoying live DJ/music and cocktails, or organize special events and meetings in the Salon Rojo and El Privat.
